info.name: 12. Github - Repo Creation and Push
info.description:
### Create a new repository in github, then go to the 'PostmanCollection' folder > command line :

```
echo "# Postman_Repo" >> README.md
git init
git add README.md
git commit -m "first commit"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/dharanichandrasekar/Postman_Repo.git
git push -u origin main

```

### push an existing repository from the command line

```
git remote add origin https://github.com/dharanichandrasekar/Postman_Repo.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main

```

_**\*\\_

**Step 1** : Download and Install Git

**Step 2** : Create GitHub account

**Step 3** : Create one new Repo named as “Postman_Repo” into Git, then keep the project files in your  
local folder(location of Postman Project collection in D folder), then Goto Command Prompt

**Commands**:

- git init
- git status
- git add or git add .
- git commit -m "this is my first commit message"
- git status
- git remote add origin [https://github.com/dharanichandrasekar/Postman_Repo.git](https://github.com/dharanichandrasekar/SoapUI_Repo.git)
- git remot
- git push -u origin master
    

Step 4 : Validate changes are pushed to repository in Github site

****\*
